articles.headline: For U.S.-Nigeria Go-Between, Ties Yield Profits
articles.snippet: GoodWorks International has become a lightning rod in Nigeria as the country prepares to elect a new president.
articles.abstract: GoodWorks International has become a lightning rod in Nigeria as the country prepares to elect a new president.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAGOS, Nigeria — For years, Andrew Young, the civil rights leader, has been deeply involved in this country through the lobbying and consulting firm he heads, GoodWorks International. Its motto is: “We do well by doing good.”

articles.headline: Clear Channel Is Said to Get Raised Bid
articles.snippet: Two private equity firms raised their offer for Clear Channel by more than $1.5 billion, to about $27.6 billion.
articles.abstract: Two private equity firms raised their offer for Clear Channel by more than $1.5 billion, to about $27.6 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two private equity firms raised their offer for Clear Channel Communications by more than $1.5 billion yesterday, to about $27.6 billion, according to people involved in the negotiations.

articles.headline: Yahoo’s Earnings Are Down 11 Percent
articles.snippet: Revenue and income were below expectations, suggesting that an overhaul of the search advertising system has yet to deliver.
articles.abstract: Revenue and income were below expectations, suggesting that an overhaul of the search advertising system has yet to deliver.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, April 17 — Yahoo’s top executives have been focused this year on an effort nicknamed Panama, after the vast canal project undertaken in the face of adversity. It is a major overhaul of the company’s search advertising system, intended to increase revenue and close a growing gap with Google, the leader in Internet search.

articles.headline: Gunman Showed Signs of Anger
articles.snippet: Cho Seung-Hui rarely spoke to his own roommate and teachers were disturbed by his violent writings.
articles.abstract: Cho Seung-Hui rarely spoke to his own roommate and teachers were disturbed by his violent writings.
articles.lead_paragraph: BLACKSBURG, Va., April 18 — Cho Seung-Hui rarely spoke to his own dormitory roommate. His teachers were so disturbed by some of his writing that they referred him to counseling. And when Mr. Cho finally and horrifyingly came to the world’s attention on Monday, he did so after writing a note that bitterly lashed out at his fellow students for what he deemed their moral decay.
articles.byline: By Manny Fernandez and Marc Santora

articles.headline: U.S. Limits Access to Student Loan Database
articles.snippet: Officials were concerned that marketers were improperly obtaining private information on potential borrowers.
articles.abstract: Officials were concerned that marketers were improperly obtaining private information on potential borrowers.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Education Department last night cut off outside access to a government database that contains the personal financial information of millions of student aid applicants.

articles.headline: The Advisers Are Writing Our Future
articles.snippet: The early economic advisers to presidential candidates can leave a big imprint if their candidate prevails.
articles.abstract: The early economic advisers to presidential candidates can leave a big imprint if their candidate prevails.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the late 1990s, a small team of economists began traveling down to Austin, Tex., for occasional visits with Gov. George W. Bush, then an unannounced candidate for president. The economists were mostly old Republican policy hands. The youngest member of the group — the only one who hadn’t worked for Ronald Reagan or Gerald Ford — was Glenn Hubbard, a Columbia professor in his early 40s.

articles.headline: Dow Index Flirts With New High
articles.snippet: The economy remains on an even keel, with inflation showing signs of easing and growth not slipping too far.
articles.abstract: The economy remains on an even keel, with inflation showing signs of easing and growth not slipping too far.
articles.lead_paragraph: The economy remains on an even keel, reports released yesterday by the government suggested, with underlying inflation showing signs of easing and growth not slipping too far.

articles.headline: Sudan Flying Arms to Darfur, Panel Reports
articles.snippet: A U.N. report says the military equipment is being flown into Darfur in violation of Security Council resolutions.
articles.abstract: A U.N. report says the military equipment is being flown into Darfur in violation of Security Council resolutions.
articles.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, April 17 — A confidential United Nations report says the government of Sudan is flying arms and heavy military equipment into Darfur in violation of Security Council resolutions and painting Sudanese military planes white to disguise them as United Nations or African Union aircraft.

articles.headline: Two-Hour Delay Is Linked to Bad Lead
articles.snippet: Virginia Tech officials were pursuing what appears to have been a fruitless lead after the first shooting when the second began.
articles.abstract: Virginia Tech officials were pursuing what appears to have been a fruitless lead after the first shooting when the second began.
articles.lead_paragraph: BLACKSBURG, Va., April 17 — The police identified Cho Seung-Hui, a 23-year-old student, as the killer of 32 people in the shooting rampage at the Virginia Polytechnic Institute, releasing new information on Tuesday about the troubled mind of a young man few people on campus knew.
articles.byline: By Shaila Dewan and John M. Broder

articles.headline: China Leans Less on U.S. Trade
articles.snippet: Chinese companies are finding their fastest growth in the world’s rapidly growing economies, not the United States.
articles.abstract: Chinese companies are finding their fastest growth in the world’s rapidly growing economies, not the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: GUANGZHOU, China, April 16 — At booth after booth at China’s main trade fair this week, the refrain from Chinese business executives is the same: the American market is not as crucial as it used to be.
